multiple_choice_question.text: This equation represents the factorization of the wavefunction into what two components?
This equation defines the probability density current (J) in terms of what other quantities?
choices: Dimensionless density, velocity field, and Planck\'s constant.
Dimensionless entropy, velocity field, and particle mass.
Dimensionless density, phase, and particle mass.
Dimensionless entropy, phase, and Planck\'s constant.

multiple_choice_question.text: According to Property 1, which of the following statements is NOT equivalent to the other three?
choices: The action (I) is a harmonic function on D.
The complex-valued function g = S + il is analytic on D.
The stationary wavefunction ψ = exp(S + iI) is analytic on D.
The probability density is constant on D.

multiple_choice_question.text: The "analytic current" (Ĵ) is defined by exchanging what two quantities in the expression for the standard probability density current (J)?
